body.name: Western Digital RE 4TB 7200RPM 64MB Cache SATA 6.0Gb/s 3.5" Enterprise Internal Hard Drive (WD4000FYYZ) OEM
features: Industry's highest capacity nearline drive - WD RE SATA hard drives are available in capacities 4 TB to suit even the most demanding storage needs
Highest performance for business-critical applications - WD RE delivers 6 Gb/s transfer rates, sustained sequential data rates of 171 MB/s and high random I/O rates

Designed for quality and reliability - With a field-tested 1.2 million hour MTBF, this high performance drive delivers the highest level of reliability for 24x7 operation in up to 100% duty cycle applications
Dual processor - Twice the processing power to maximize performance
Worry Free Return! 100% Full Refund, 3 Years Warranty from Reseller

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #856 in Amazon Renewed (See Top 100 in Amazon Renewed) #68 in Internal Hard Drives #273 in Renewed Computers & Accessories

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Steady she goes
reviews.reviewText: I bought one of these refurbished drives for use in my home file and print server (a refurbished Dell Optiplex 7050), and have been happy with its performance so far. I've become a big fan of refurbished business-class hardware in general. The system has been up and running continuously with this drive for 17 days without the slightest hiccup.Given that these drives have a ridiculously long MTBF, plus are under warranty by the seller, it seems like a no brainer - at least for non-critical applications like mine, which is mostly multimedia storage and backup of the primary NVMe system drive.A minor nitpick is that the S.M.A.R.T attributes were all reset prior to sale, so there's no way to know details like Power-On Hours. I'm sure the number is high, but to reach the MTBF would take over 100 years of use. I performed a thorough scan under Linux before entrusting any files to it. So while I'm curious, I'm not worried. Any drive can fail at any time, so if you're not routinely backing up important data that's on you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect storage addition for my server

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A bit noisy
reviews.reviewText: I ordered two drives for a NAS and almost immediately started getting reports of errors from my monitoring software. One drive had a bad sector within hours the other started reporting errors shortly after. I contacted Amazon and had new units shipped out. The new drives have been running good for over a month. I will update if anything changes.On the noise front, they are a bit louder than i expected but it's tolerable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Run a little hot
reviews.reviewText: But they're fine at 104F. I bought 3, two have been running 10 weeks now in zoneminder installations, no problems, no errors reported by SMART.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Hard drive looked brand new and works flawlessly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely Enterprise Quality
reviews.reviewText: These drives have a heavy enterprise HDD feel typically found in high-end Fiber Enterprise Storage arrays. I have had two of these running in a 24x7 linux RAID 1 mirror set for a little over a year and neither has missed a beat. I have two more on order and plan to replace the mirror with a 14.4 TB Stripe Set. I am expecting that it should provide performance near that of a 14 TB SSD at a very economical price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 3 of 6 drives failed within 5 months
reviews.reviewText: Ordering these drives was a big mistake. The first two drives developed unrecoverable bad sectors within a month of installation. A third drive has now failed after five months, after having less than 500GB written to it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Hard drive The Price
reviews.reviewText: Using in a 2-bay NAS. Works perfectly. Would have no concerns purchasing from this company and buying another hard drive.

reviews.reviewTitle: Western Digital RE Disque dur interne d'entreprise 7200
reviews.reviewText: Bon produit, bon prix, bonne description, livraison rapide.

Funciono una semana, llego su paquete bien, cuando lo instale por primera vez todo bien no marcaba sectores dañados, solo el tiempo que estubo encendido mas de 2500 días, no le di importancia por que el conteo de start/count era bajo, tenia un conteo de 18 veces algo normal para un HDD de un centro de datos. Pero despues comenzo a hacer mucho ruido al escribir/leer datos, hice un examen para ver su estado y tenia sectores dañados, su estado general habia bajado de 100% a un 77% esto no es para nada normal en un HDD.

I bought a pair of these drives for backups in a Raid 10. After a day of data transfer and a reboot the 1 drive had a S.M.A.R.T error in bios screen. After multiple attempts to correct bad block and bad sector errors I re-formatted the drive and returned for refund. The drive was sold with 76000 running hours on it according to Sea Tools. The one that is still working has 62000 running hours on it.
